name.text: Finding displacement of an object in constant velocity motion

questiontext.text:
A car moves in a straight line with constant velocity \( v = {@v@}\,\mathrm{m/s} \) for a total time of \( {@T@}\,\mathrm{s} \).

(a) The graph below shows the displacement–time relationship \( s = {@v@}t \). A red dashed vertical line marks the time \( t {@t0@}\,\mathrm{s} \).

Use the graph to determine the displacement of the car at time \( t = {@t0@}\,\mathrm{s} \). Then drag the green point vertically so that it lies on the blue line.

[[jsxgraph width="550px" height="400px"]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-1, {#v#}*{#T#}+5, {#T#}+2, -5], axis: true, showCopyright: false, defaultAxes: { x: { name: 'Displacement (m)', withLabel: true }, y: { name: 'Time (s)', withLabel: true } } }); var v = {#v#}; var T = {#T#}; var t0 = {#t0#}; var maxDisp = v * T; // Displacement-time line board.create('segment', [[0,0],[T,maxDisp]], { strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 3 }); // Line label board.create('text', [T/2, maxDisp/2, 's = ' + v + 't'], { anchorX: 'middle', color: 'blue' }); // Vertical line at t = t0 board.create('line', [[t0,0],[t0,maxDisp]], { strokeColor: 'red', dash: 2 }); // Label for t0 board.create('text', [t0, -maxDisp*0.08, 't = ' + t0 + ' s'], { anchorX: 'middle', color: 'red' }); // Draggable point var studentPoint = board.create('point', [t0, 0], { name: '', color: 'green', size: 4 }); // Feedback text var feedback = board.create('text', [T/2, maxDisp*0.95, 'Drag the green point to find the displacement at t = ' + t0 + ' s'], { anchorX: 'middle', color: 'darkblue' }); var correctY = v * t0; // Interactive feedback studentPoint.on('drag', function() { var y = studentPoint.Y(); if (Math.abs(y - correctY) < 0.5) { feedback.setText('✓ Correct! s(' + t0 + ') = ' + correctY + ' m'); feedback.setAttribute({color:'green'}); } else { feedback.setText('Current displacement: ' + y.toFixed(1) + ' m'); feedback.setAttribute({color:'black'}); } }); board.create('grid', []); [[/jsxgraph]]

Therefore, the displacement at time \( t = {@t0@}\,\mathrm{s} \) is

\(s({@t0@}) =\) [[input:ans1]] \(\mathrm{m}\) [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

For motion with constant velocity, the displacement increases linearly with time.

The displacement is given by:

\[s(t) = v \times t\]

In this question:

\[v = {@v@}\,\text{m/s}, \quad t_0 = {@t0@}\,\text{s}\]

Therefore:

\[s({@t0@}) = {@v@} \times {@t0@} = {@ta@}\,\text{m}\]

On the displacement–time graph, this corresponds to reading the vertical value of the straight line at time \(t_0\) and displacement {@ta@}
